creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
FCKeditor doesn't use the fallback mechanism when loading clean-resourcetype.xsl
files to clean content. It does this in Java with the following code:

xsltSource = (ModifiableSource) resolver.resolveURI(resType
                            .getFormatURI(XSLT_CLEAN_FORMAT));
Transformer t = tfac.newTransformer(new StreamSource(xsltSource
                            .getInputStream()));

I'm guessing there is a better way of doing this.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
Strange, the xslt-clean URL actually uses the fallback protocol
(modules/xhtml/config/cocoon-xconf/resource-type-xhtml.xconf):

<format name="xslt-clean"
uri="fallback://lenya/modules/xhtml/xslt/clean-xhtml.xsl"/>

Maybe the FCKeditor isn't called using a publication-based URL, so that the
fallback doesn't catch?
creator: andreas@apache.org

text:
The xsltSource URI is:
file:/home/rfrovarp/lenya-1.4.x/build/lenya/webapp/lenya/pubs/edchanges/lenya/modules/xhtml/xslt/clean-xhtml.xsl

It's throwing this to the console:

SystemId Unknown; Line #25; Column #100; Had IO Exception with stylesheet file:
fallback://lenya/modules/kupu/resources/kupu/apache-lenya/lenya/kupusave.xsl
SystemId Unknown; Line #26; Column #85; Had IO Exception with stylesheet file:
fallback://lenya/modules/bxe/xslt/change-object-path-back.xsl

If I change the fallback lines to farrback, it throws the same error, just with
the different protocol in the file portion. How does the fallback protocol get
registered with the XSLT parser? That seems to be the missing piece.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org

text:
I think I know what needs to be done. I should be able to get it taken care of
before the freeze.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
FCK has been moved to contributions.

I think with Kupu being moved to unsupported, this error would be cleared up.
